articles.author: Marianne Guenot
articles.title: Tooth proves extinct human species lived in SE Asia 130,000+ years ago - Business Insider
articles.description: Scientists were looking at how humans in southeast Asia today have some genes of an ancient human species mostly recorded in Siberia.
articles.content:
Remains of a now-extinct ancient human species called Denisovans were found in southeast Asia for the first time.
Scientists were seeking remains from Denisovans in the area because they knew that s… [+3581 chars]

articles.title: Stock rally losing puff as economic growth doubts grow - Reuters
articles.description: Asia's stock markets eked out their fourth straight session of gains on Wednesday, but the recent rally lost momentum as nagging doubts about inflation and the drag from rate rises overshadowed bits and pieces of good news about the global growth outlook.

articles.author: Kira Westaway, Mike W Morley, Renaud Joannes-Boyau
articles.title: A fossil tooth places enigmatic ancient humans in Southeast Asia - The Conversation
articles.description: The mysterious Denisovans left DNA traces in populations across Southeast Asia and Australasia, but until now no physical signs of their presence outside Eurasia had been found.
articles.content:
What do a finger bone and some teeth found in the frigid Denisova Cave in Siberias Altai mountains have in common with fossils from the balmy hills of tropical northern Laos?
